meanings.definition: To shout or call loudly to someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She holloas for her dog when it runs away.
meanings.sent2: The coach holloas instructions to the players during the game.
meanings.sent3: The children holloas with excitement when they see the ice cream truck.
meanings.sent4: The protesters holloas for justice in the streets.
meanings.sent5: The teacher holloas for attention before starting the lesson.

meanings.sent1: His holloas echoed through the forest as he called for help.
meanings.sent2: The holloas of the fans filled the stadium during the game.
meanings.sent3: The sudden holloas of the baby startled the cat.
meanings.sent4: The holloas of the auctioneer raised the bids in the room.
meanings.sent5: The holloas of the lifeguard alerted everyone to the swimmer in trouble.
